perturbation.original_text: 2.   Terms of Payment: Party B agrees to pay Party A the Intellectual Property License fees (the "License Fees") and the specified amount of the license fees and the form of payment are set forth in Appendix 2. Party A has the right to exempt the obligation of payment or adjust the amount of the License Fees set forth in Appendix 2 according to the actual circumstances from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.   Terms of Payment: Party B agrees to pay Party A the Intellectual Property License fees (the "License Fees") and the specified amount of the license fees and the form of payment are set forth in Appendix 2. Party A has the right to unilaterally increase the amount of the License Fees set forth in Appendix 2 according to the actual circumstances from time to time.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding Party A's power over license fees. The original text states that Party A can exempt or adjust the fees, implying a degree of flexibility potentially benefiting Party B. The modified text states that Party A can unilaterally increase fees, removing the potential benefit to Party B and contradicting the original intent by suggesting that Party A has total discretion over fee increases.

perturbation.original_text:
Appendix 2 Account and payment method of License Fee

Party B should pay for All Intellectual Property RMB 1,000,000 per year to Party A as license fee. Party B shall pay the license fee to the account designated by Party A before December 31 each year. Party A has the right to determine whether or not to exempt the Party B's obligation to pay license fee at its discretion.
perturbation.changed_text:
Appendix 2 Account and payment method of License Fee

Party B should pay for All Intellectual Property RMB 1,000,000 per year to Party A as license fee. Party B shall pay the license fee to the account designated by Party A before June 30 each year. Party A has the right to determine whether or not to exempt the Party B's obligation to pay license fee at its discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement specifies that the license fee payment is due before December 31st each year. The modified text changes the payment deadline to June 30th each year. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the payment deadline, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes regarding when the payment is actually due.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1   Early Termination

Without prejudice to any legal or other rights or remedies of the party who asks for termination of this Agreement, any Party has the right to terminate this Agreement immediately with written notice to the other party in the event the other party materially breaches this Agreement including but not limited to the obligation under Article 3 of this Agreement and fails to cure its breach within thirty (30) days from the date it receives written notice of its breach from the non-breaching party. During the term of this Agreement, Party A may terminate this Agreement at any time with a written notice to Party B 30 days before such termination.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1   Early Termination

Without prejudice to any legal or other rights or remedies of the party who asks for termination of this Agreement, any Party has the right to terminate this Agreement immediately with written notice to the other party in the event the other party materially breaches this Agreement including but not limited to the obligation under Article 3 of this Agreement and fails to cure its breach within thirty (30) days from the date it receives written notice of its breach from the non-breaching party. During the term of this Agreement, Party A may terminate this Agreement at any time with a written notice to Party B 60 days before such termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Party A can terminate the agreement with 30 days written notice to Party B. The modified text changes this notice period to 60 days. This creates a conflict regarding the required notice period for termination by Party A, leading to ambiguity about the actual amount of notice required, creating an in-text contradiction.
